rev.comment: anyone can claim anything they want
rev.diff:
Line 24: Line 24:
Essentially, the OFFSystem works on the same principle as a weak [[one time pad]] (commonly used for encrypting messages during [[World War II]]). A block of random numbers is associated to a [[key (cryptography)|cypher key]]. Because the numbers in the data block are random, only the key gives them meaning. This allows the same block to be used with multiple keys to represent different parts of different messages.
Essentially, the OFFSystem works on the same principle as a weak [[one time pad]] (commonly used for encrypting messages during [[World War II]]). A block of random numbers is associated to a [[key (cryptography)|cypher key]]. Because the numbers in the data block are random, only the key gives them meaning. This allows the same block to be used with multiple keys to represent different parts of different messages.
â
Notably for [[plausible deniability]], any given block may be used for an [[infinite]] number of files for reconstruction purposes, thus making it impossible for an entity to claim that any one block should fall under their [[copyright]]. No data stored in the system is encrypted, compressed, or split into chunks because it does not represent the original data inserted to begin with.
+
Notably for [[plausible deniability]], any given block may be used for an [[infinite]] number of files for reconstruction purposes, thus it is not expected for an entity to claim that any one block should fall under their [[copyright]]. No data stored in the system is encrypted, compressed, or split into chunks because it does not represent the original data inserted to begin with.
==Transmission of non-copyrighted material==
